column1: The marathon is a long-distance running event with an official distance of 42.195 kilometres (26 miles and 385 yards)
column2: that is usually run as a road race. The event was instituted in commemoration of the fabled run of the Greek soldier Pheidippides
column3: a messenger from the Battle of Marathon to Athens.

column1: According to the Theodore Roosevelt Association
column2: Mr. Roosevelt was the first president to be submerged in a submarine; the first president to own a car; the first to have a telephone in his home; and the first to entertain an African-American

column1: Students find out that a fire needs three things to start and continue burning: oxygen
column2: fuel and heat. A fire requires three basic components: fuel
column3: oxygen from air and heat. To control the fire
column4: at least one of these components must be removed.

column1: The vernal equinox occurs on March 20 or 21 and the autumnal equinox on September 22 or 23
column2: marking the beginning of spring and autumn
column4: in the Northern Hemisphere (and the reverse in the Southern Hemisphere). The days on which an equinox falls have about equal periods of sunlight and darkness.

column1: As for the rest of Seattle's days
column2: we average 226 cloudy days (4th most in the U.S.) and 81 partly cloudy days. Of all those days
column3: we get 155 days of rain a year (we've had 97 so far this year.)
